meanings.definition: To cover or protect with a cap.
meanings.sent1: I will becap my head with a hat before going outside.
meanings.sent2: She always becaps her head with a scarf in the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The little girl decided to becap her toy bear with a tiny cap.
meanings.sent4: The knight becapped himself with a shiny helmet before battle.
meanings.sent5: The gardener becapped the delicate flower with a protective cover during the storm.

meanings.definition: A cap worn on the head.
meanings.sent1: He wore a becap to shield his head from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The becap matched her outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The becap flew off in the strong wind, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The becap of clouds covered the sky, signaling an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The becap of the bottle kept the drink fresh and fizzy.
